newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean top appliance makers announce price cuts.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean top appliance makers announce price cuts.

text.p: South Korea's top three electronic home appliance makers said on Monday that they have cut prices by up to 20 percent on major home appliances, effective immediately.
Officials at Samsung Electronics Co, Daewoo Electronics Co and LG Electronics Inc said the moves were aimed at "joining the government's calls for efforts to cap the consumer inflation".
The firms are core units of Samsung Group, Daewoo Group and LG Group, respectively.
Samsung announced price cuts of between three and 15 percent, Daewoo by between 2.4 percent and 20 percent and LG by between three and 15.3 percent.
The government has urged the nation to join its efforts to check the inflationary pressure, resulting mainly from increased international prices on its major imports.
